question: Which of the following is correct definition of the Lacustrine deposits?
option1: sedimentary rock formations in the bottom of ancient lakes
option2: metamorphic landscape formed on the deep ocean floor
option3: ring shaped coral reef that encircles a lagoon partially or completely
option4: natural areas in which the ground is covered with salt and other minerals
answer: sedimentary rock formations in the bottom of ancient lakes
explanation: Lacustrine deposits are sedimentary rock formations which formed in the bottom of ancient lakes. A common characteristic of lacustrine deposits is that a river or stream channel has carried sediment into the basin.
